creator: xfm@hotmail.com
text:
There is a problem when trying to prevent IE5 & IE5.5 to cache webpages. Even 
though you set the request headers (Pragma,Expires,Cache-Control..) properly, 
IE still caches the webpage.  When you use tomcat with Apache, you do not 
experience this problem.  I found a URL (supplied), with someones attempt to 
patch the webserver.jar file.  It seems to resolves the problem (but didn't 
fully test it to see if other issues arise from the modifications).

creator: xfm@hotmail.com
text:
The problem is that the response headers are HTTP/1.0, and the cache headers 
aren't unless its HTTP/1.1.

For a quick fix, in org/apache/tomcat/service/http/HttpResponseAdapter.java
I changed printHead("HTTP/1.0 ") in send status to printHead("HTTP/1.1 ")

and in  org/apache/tomcat/adapter/HttpAdapter.java 
headAppend("HTTP/1.0 ") to headAppend("HTTP/1.1 ")

Its really not a bug, its just that Cache-Control Header is not supported 
under HTTP 1.0

As described in the comment below, this isn't a bug, but a limitation of 
HTTP/1.0 which is all that 3.2.x supports.  Tomcat 3.3 and 4.0 support HTTP/1.1 
and do not have this problem.
